intro: Celmisia gibbsii, commonly known as the Mount Cook celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and it produces yellow or orange flowers in late spring to early summer. Celmisia gibbsii is an important part of New Zealand's native flora and is often found in areas with rocky or gravelly soils.
